To amend the Federal Reserve Act to establish requirements for policy rules and blackout periods of
			 the Federal Open Market Committee, to establish requirements for certain

			 for other purposes.

header.#text: Requirements for a Directive Policy Rule

text.#text: identify the Policy Instrument the Directive Policy Rule is designed to target;

include a function that comprehensively models the interactive relationship between the

a detailed justification for that departure; and

a description of the circumstances under which the Directive Policy Rule may be amended in the
			 future;

include a certification that such Rule is expected to support the economy in achieving stable
			 prices and maximum natural employment over the long term; and

include a calculation that describes with mathematical precision the expected annual inflation rate
			 over a 5-year period.

header.#text: Federal Open Market Committee blackout period

text.#text:
During a blackout period, the only public communications that may be made by members and staff of
			 the Committee with respect to macroeconomic or financial developments or
			 about current or prospective monetary policy issues are the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System

			 meeting takes place; and
ends at midnight on the day after the date on which such meeting takes place.

			 regulation, differentiating between public and private sector jobs.
